column4: I would imagine the ISO was "burned" to the USB drive, not just copied.
Letterbomb05: if you have it not as .iso, to a mount -obind /directory/on/usb/with/iso/content /where/it/should/be/mounted
Yeah, but that's assuming a running system, not the installer.
sure,i dontknow if the installer accepts that - if it does only check for existance of files or if it checks the mount output including FS etc
